author: donna.vanderloo
title: Token issuance, backed by land
description: 16%的土壤寿命小于100年，失去了碳、水和营养物质[1]。农民希望再生，但在经济压力下进行开发。

f6_assessments.q0: 不幸的是，我认为这对Cardano生态系统的影响不大，也没有很好地满足挑战要求。我认为这是因为：这里的想法是翻新土地，也就是说，在土地上工作，赋予其品质，这些土地是通过代币在Cardano购买的。在区块链中创造新的资产、智能合约等部分，对生态系统有什么好处，但资金量太大，只能在生态系统中进行这些活动。在我看来，这个项目需要投入更多的资金，给Cardano一个回报。我相信这个项目将大大有利于拉丁美洲的位置，不仅是土地更新的行为，也是随着项目产生的就业机会（这里的许多员工将来自拉丁美洲，特别是那些做现场活动的人）。在这方面，这是毫无疑问的。但是，正如我所说，有必要更好地衡量对Cardano的回报，我们不知道到底会产生多少代币，平均有多少人会被吸引到这个生态系统，以及这样的细节。这就是为什么我认为这不是一个能很好地满足这个挑战所要求的项目。
f6_assessments.q1: 没有提供关于团队的信息。事实上，有几个专业人员会在这里工作，正如我们在开支部门的部分可以看到的。但他们是谁？我们需要单独了解每个团队成员，姓名，角色，与Cardano区块链的关系，等等。细节越多越好，遗憾的是我们这里没有任何相关细节。关于脚本，我认为它是平均的，有些步骤解释得比较好，如Q1 - 2022，而有些步骤，如Q4 - 2022，只用一句话就概括了。我们知道这里有一个行动计划，这使我们很好地理解将做什么。但是，如果这些信息能与时间表很好地联系起来，也就是说，每一个小部分都符合进程的一个步骤，以一种时间性和组织性的方式，这样我们对整体有一个更坚实的理解，那就很有意思。而关于财务部门，这是最有待改进的部分，因为要价很高，而且各部分都没有解释。例如，他们为一个促销活动要价5万，但他们没有解释任何有关情况。他们没有说这是什么类型的活动，将以什么方式推出，哪些目标受众，哪些专业人士会工作......5万往往是整个提案的要价，所以如果他们只为项目的一部分要求这个价格，那就需要很多细节了。不幸的是，提案的这一部分还有很多不足之处。
f6_assessments.q2: 可审计性是好的，我们可以从几个方面来做。首先，通过监测行动计划中提到的活动是否真正得到了执行，而且是以适当的方式。第二，通过影响分析；他们致力于建立对拉丁美洲的预期影响。在这方面，很有可能对预期的结果进行定性和定量的分析：这可以由Cardano社区和项目团队共同完成。最后，还画出了一些与分析提案的结果和方式直接相关的题目（可以说是项目的关键绩效指标）。换句话说，团队给了我们几种方法来监测他们的提案，但他们也需要让我们知道农场何时接受有机产品认证机构的审核。如果每次访问都能起草一份报告并直接提交给Cardano社区，那就更理想了。也就是说，在我看来，这是提案中涵盖的最好的主题。

f6_assessments.q0: This idea is exceptionally compelling for me, in part because it contains many components that on the one hand correspond to the spirit of Cardano and Catalyst and on the other hand have a strong social / environmental component. The proposal involves tokenizing land in order to enable regrowth of land using proven ecological methods. This will address the issue of farmers not being able to ensure a healthy regeneration of land between harvest seasons. This proposal is very relevant to LATAM as food exports to developed countries represent one of many countries' main sources of income. In addition, I understand how this proposal can encourage new users to join the community. However, I must say that it was not possible to evaluate the alignment of the metrics since they were not included.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal team describes in detail the skills and experiences in their web page that was provided as a reference. They have also described achievements with their "land-management and forest regeneration" method in previous years, although references would have been helpful to verify these results. An action plan is presented; however, I find it to be very general, which makes it difficult to evaluate its feasibility. Another aspect that could be improved in the proposal is the description of the associated tokenomics. Although there is a brief description of the token utility, it is crucial to provide a detailed description of the logic behind the generation of these tokens for a proposal like this one, which is based on the generation of this economy to contribute to the purchase and regeneration of land. Regarding the budget, I believe it is also imperative that for future Catalyst cycles, the team concentrates its efforts on improving this section. Although it is very positive that the topic has been broken down into identifiable areas, some of them need to be better explained. An example is the line item for "Developers to launch the token" which is estimated at $60,000 but does not explain the cost per hour, the number of developers needed, or for how long the developers are needed. Another example could be, the item for "Promotion campaign" would be estimated at $50,000, in which case you would have to provide answers to questions such as: How many professionals are you planning to hire? Which methods will be used for promotion? What is the expected result of this promotion? Unfortunately, no answers to these questions are provided. Lastly, I would like to mention another issue with the budget that I find is that actions are described to ensure auditability, but it is not clear whether or not these actions are considered as line items within the budget. Especially periodic audits by external agencies tend to be very costly.
f6_assessments.q2: Finally, we arrive at the section regarding auditability, which has its highs and lows. Although some of the milestones described can be confusing, I consider it a positive that it lays out a roadmap until 2024 with details about what can be expected every quarter.  Furthermore, the community will be able to access all the costs associated with the project, including contracts on chain, external audits, and images of what is happening in the farms. There is another aspect of this proposal that can be improved: the description of the success metrics. Although some of the metrics presented can be analyzed, it is necessary to make much more effort in this regard, especially considering that 37% of the budget allocated for this challenge is being requested.

f6_assessments.q0:
This is very interesting, original case and idea. It could be a unicorn in Cardano ecosystem.
I strongly agree that this project is in line with Cardano community's mission and goals. 
All the statements are clearly articulated and defined to strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. If implemented successfully, this could evolve on global scale.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan to tokenize the farmland and infrastructure of the local farmers, thus bring financial incentives to regenerate fertile land through good ecological methods, is well documented. 
The proposer expresses extensive experience in reforestation, business, and a 4 year position at the Ministry of the Environment of Brazil.
I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap begins in Q1 2022 and leads to Q4 2023, with addition to extend into 2024 and onward. The proposer emphasizes on max transparency by informing their investors through an app, with all spending details to be seen, all contracts will be on chain, the farms will be audited periodically by certified institution.
I strongly agree and rate auditability with the highest score of 5.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea around this proposal is of a real concrete impact on the environment and the people, by improving the social & economical conditions of the farmers in Brazil.
Tokenize the land and buildings of the founders, Issuing on the Cardano Network will popularize the use of that ecosystem by a large community composed by farmers and the other partners who collaborate in their agriculture activities.
By doing this, it responds to the objective on this challenge and is in alignment
f6_assessments.q1:
Proposers have been in the Cardano community for almost five years now (since 2017), which shows their expertise in how the Cardano blockchain is built and ran.
No much information about the other Proposers. Time frame and plan of execution are defined and realistic, but it would have been important to detail some sections of the budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability is described by proposers to allow the community to follow the progress. They have mentioned, for exemple, – There will be a simple app to login to, its spending for all to be seen.
– All the contracts will be available on chain.
– The farms will be audited periodically by the certification institute for organic produce.
Interesting is to see  the sustainability plan of the project plan around 2024 onward.
No much risks were pointed out, but for a big project like that will involve various stakeholders/Partners, they may be some risks. Hope to see you reveal some oh those risks in your final version

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal poses a great problem of wanting to regenerate nutrient-depleted agricultural land. The proposal is very well thought out, very mature in its presentation and clearly argued for its suitability in the set of challenges. this. Some of the most important aspects of the challenge will be addressed by this project.
f6_assessments.q1:
Much information is missing on feasibility, as mentioned, and it would be nice if they were included in a future resubmission. While the proposal idea is great, you also present reasons why the proposal should be implemented. However, it lacks too many factors to assess the success of the project, such as how the team will perform, the proposed budget is not transparent and the lack of urban success indicators. So sorry I rate 2 points for this recommendation
There is no evidence for any of their experiences. I think you should publicize your team and their capabilities, and that's one of the reasons why I disagree with the proposals that will be successfully implemented. It would be better if the proponent provided a list of potential future risks and challenges.
f6_assessments.q2:
Several milestones can be made from the plan but no indicators are suggested. Proposing a 3-year roadmap, I think it is advisable to give a specific action plan, a shorter time frame for us to easily check.
The proposal requires a large amount of capital, $185,000 more than a third of the fund's capital. But there are expenses that need more detail like a $50,000 ad campaign, which seems like a pretty big amount but doesn't have any explanation.
To increase testability, proponents can add several KPIs and metrics to help people outside the organization do better if milestones are reached. Scaling data/KPIs to measure success will benefit your proposal

f6_assessments.q0: This is a very good proposal, I support the purpose and the proposed plan to achieve it. Having said that I don't see any alignment with the challenge. This is a very significant amount of resources and a failed to see how it impacts Cardano's growth in Latam. Treasury's funds for this challenge should be allocated to proposals with a clearer short term impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
-The funding requested (185k) is quite elevated considering it does not include the land itself. (which is a rather small plot of 9.5 hectares)
- 100k of the 185k requested go to "promotion campaign" and "Finishing touch on the existing infrastructure" without any details. 
- The team behind seems to have a clear long term roadmap on how to implement successfully the proposal, but no specific KPIs are provided that can be used to assess success.
f6_assessments.q2:
- At this stage the auditability proposal seems healthy, being such a long term plan the Community might get distracted in the long term.
- No clear, quantifiable goals are proposed. Therefore success asessment will be a subjective exercise.

f6_assessments.q0: The project is very meaningful and very promising to have a great impact on people in the area. Improving agricultural land means improving the local economic ecosystem, not to mention the impact on the environment. Cardano mission is to support the implementation of great projects like this to contribute to changing the world.
f6_assessments.q1: He is experienced in related fields: reforesting land, business and even in Government of Environment. He join the Cardano Catalyst very early, understand and believe in the great potential of Cardano ecosystem. The proposal explain his solution in a very detail and understandable way. He knows what he says. The proposal also includes detail plan and analysis, which demonstrates that it's highly likely the plan can be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability is explained well on the proposal: the project will be very transparent and easy to track the behavior or progress of it. The goals are also very clear and on point: having quantity and timing for each goal.

f6_assessments.q0: A strong way to engage communities in learning about blockchain is to use it to solve problems that are relevant to the community. Certainly this addresses an issue important to Brazilians and uses a long-earned set of expertise to begin to shift mindset. It also incorporates tokens in a real-world way, which protects and preserves natural resources important to us all. This is a highly specialized project, and if the model can be demonstrated, will enable other countries and communities to use it as a blueprint. The tokenizing of the land in this project and launching on the Cardano network gives an opportunity to highlight the creative use of this project in helping a local community and population as well as engaging those community members in the Cardano community, which is a key component of that challenge. If implemented successfully, this project will be meaningful, useful and impactful at the micro and macro levels.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal has a lot going for it. The key proposer has already accomplished the transformation of the land over the past decade, which is a fundamental need for expanding the method and teaching others. He also has a decade in business in the Netherlands, which merges European and Latin American mindsets. The creative use of tokens and cryptocurrency will provide a grassroots teaching opportunity to the communities involved in the project, so that communities become healthier and are introduced to blockchain technology simultaneously. The tokenizing of the land and engaging global partners who support this sustainable cause has great potential to equip many thoughtful people with a new understanding of how cryptocurrency can be utilized to solve environmental issues. I don't see a developer on the team, so this is one key role that will need to be filled and is a significant cost within the budget.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers have built in both professional organizations and project metrics to serve as evaluating bodies for the success of the undertaking. The need to audit the farmland itself (by the certifying bodies listed in the proposal) is a key element here, as the transparency and trustworthiness of what is happening on the ground will play a large role in maintaining trustworthiness of the project overall and the infusion of blockchain technology learning in Latin America through this work. As this challenge aims to bring more Latin American community members into the Cardano fold, it would be strong to see this proposal include methods for engaging the participants in the farming/agricultural roles AND the growth of the organization into new areas as a whole. Perhaps workshops on cryptocurrency could also be held at the location in addition to the agricultural workshops? What about partnerships between token holders and those who teach/care for the land? Involving qualified community members on the boards/ committees/governance groups? It would also be strong to understand how the team plans to chronicle and share their experience and findings with other groups so that their work could be replicated easily and do more good.

solution: Cardano社区拥有的农田（代币化）将以农林Götsch-方法再生。代币由越来越多的肥沃土地支持。
experience:
2011年-现在在巴西自己的土地上重新造林。
在荷兰做生意10年。
在环境部工作了4年的政策官员。
